func_extract package

Submodules

func_extract.extruct module

func_extract.extruct.extract_content_in_range(page, start_y, end_y)[source]

Extracts text content within a specified vertical range on a page.

func_extract.extruct.extract_sections_from_pdf(pdf_file_path)[source]

this function take the path of a pdf file and return a dictionary that contains the title , the abstract , the keywords , the authors , the institutions , the references and the inner text of the pdf file it uses the pdfminer library to extract the text from the pdf file so the identification of the sections is based on the position of the text on the page and all the work is been done manually it is very efficient for pdf files that are in the same format and the same structure

func_extract.extruct.extract_sections_from_pdf_gpt3(pdf_file_path)[source]

this function take the path of a pdf file and return a dictionary that contains the title , the abstract , the keywords , the authors , the institutions , the references and the inner text of the pdf file it uses the openai gpt3.5 to extract the sections from the pdf file while maintaining the structure of the sections

func_extract.extruct.extract_text_from_first_page_of_pdf(pdf_file_path)[source]

this function take the path of a pdf file and return the text of the first page of the pdf file as a utf-8 string it uses the pdfminer library to extract the text from the pdf file loop through the pages of the pdf file and extract the text from the text containers

func_extract.extruct.extract_text_from_last_page_of_pdf(pdf_file_path)[source]

this function take the path of a pdf file and return the text of the last 10 pages of the pdf file as a utf-8 string it uses the pdfminer library to extract the text from the pdf file loop through the pages of the pdf file and extract the text from the text containers

func_extract.extruct.extract_title_from_pdf(pdf_file_path)[source]

this function to get the title of the pdf file we assume that the title has the biggest font size in the pdf file while taking into considiration that the title might be in multiple lines note that in some pdf files the title is not the biggest text in the pdf file or the title is not in the first page of the pdf file , in that case the function will not work properly

func_extract.extruct.getInnerText(pdf_file_path)[source]

this function take the path of a pdf file and return the inner text of the pdf file as a utf-8 string it uses the pdfminer library to extract the text from the pdf file loop through the pages of the pdf file and extract the text from the text containers and the characters

func_extract.extruct.get_thumbnail_from_pdf(pdf_file_path)[source]

this function take the path of a pdf file and return the thumbnail of the first page of the pdf file as a base64 string it uses the fitz library to extract the image of the first page of the pdf file the image is then converted to a base64 string

func_extract.extruct.process_pdf_file(pdf_file_path)[source]

this function takes the file , extracts the sections and uploads the file to dropbox

func_extract.extruct.upload_file_to_dropbox(file_path, dropbox_folder='/articles', overwrite=False)[source]

Module contents
